Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.Synopsis: Public IP addresses should be deployed with Standard SKU for production workloads.
Azure.PublicIP.StandardSKU.Recommendation: Consider using Standard SKU for Public IP addresses deployed in production.

Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Name: Azure.ACR.ContainerScan
Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Synopsis: Enable vulnerability scanning for container images.
Azure.ACR.ContainerScan.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Cloud to scan for security vulnerabilities in container images.

Azure.AppGw.WAFRules.Name: Azure.AppGw.WAFRules
Azure.AppGw.WAFRules.Synopsis: Application Gateway Web Application Firewall (WAF) should have all rules enabled.
Azure.AppGw.WAFRules.Recommendation:
Consider enabling all OWASP rules within Application Gateway instances.
Before disabling OWASP rules, ensure that the backend workload has alternative protections in-place. Alternatively consider updating application code to use safe web standards.

Azure.VM.PromoSku.Name: Azure.VM.PromoSku
Azure.VM.PromoSku.Synopsis: Virtual machines (VMs) should not use expired promotional SKU.
Azure.VM.PromoSku.Recommendation: Consider moving from promotional SKUs to SKUs eligible for reserved instances for VMs with an extended life cycle. Consider moving from promotional SKUs to the regular SKU once the promotional period has expired.

Azure.Defender.Api.Name: Azure.Defender.Api
Azure.Defender.Api.DisplayName: Set Microsoft Defender for APIs to the Standard tier
Azure.Defender.Api.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for APIs to provide additional security for APIs published in Azure API Management.

Azure.APIM.MinAPIVersion.Name: Azure.APIM.MinAPIVersion
Azure.APIM.MinAPIVersion.DisplayName: API Management API versions prior to 2021-08-01 will be retired
Azure.APIM.MinAPIVersion.Synopsis: API Management instances should limit control plane API calls to API Management with version '2021-08-01' or newer.
Azure.APIM.MinAPIVersion.Recommendation: Limit control plane API calls to API Management with version '2021-08-01' or newer.

Azure.FrontDoor.MinTLS.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.MinTLS
Azure.FrontDoor.MinTLS.Synopsis: Front Door Classic instances should reject TLS versions older than 1.2.
Azure.FrontDoor.MinTLS.Recommendation: Consider configuring the minimum supported TLS version to be 1.2 for each endpoint. This applies to Azure Front Door Classic instances only.

Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Name: Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.DisplayName: Review Azure MariaDB server firewall permitted public IP addresses
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Synopsis: Determine if there is an excessive number of permitted IP addresses.
Azure.MariaDB.FirewallIPRange.Recommendation: Review the number of Azure for MariaDB server firewall permitted public IP addresses configured. Consider to removing IP addresses that are no longer needed.

Azure.SQLMI.ManagedIdentity.Name: Azure.SQLMI.ManagedIdentity
Azure.SQLMI.ManagedIdentity.Synopsis: Ensure managed identity is used to allow support for Azure AD authentication.
Azure.SQLMI.ManagedIdentity.Recommendation: Consider configure a managed identity to allow support for Azure AD authentication.

Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Name: Azure.Template.LocationDefault
Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Synopsis: Set the default value for the location parameter within an ARM template to resource group location.
Azure.Template.LocationDefault.Recommendation: Consider updating the location parameter to use [resourceGroup().location] as the default value.

Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.Name: Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue
Azure.Deployment.OutputSecretValue.Recommendation: Consider removing any output values that return secret values in code.

Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity
Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Synopsis: Disable session affinity to prevent unbalanced distribution.
Azure.ContainerApp.DisableAffinity.Recommendation: Consider disabling session affinity to evenly distribute requests across each replica.

Azure.Storage.FileShareSoftDelete.Name: Azure.Storage.FileShareSoftDelete
Azure.Storage.FileShareSoftDelete.Synopsis: Enable fileshare soft delete on Storage Accounts
Azure.Storage.FileShareSoftDelete.Recommendation: Consider enabling soft delete on fileshares to protect files from accidential deletion or modification.

Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Name: Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade
Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Synopsis: Configure AKS to automatically upgrade to newer supported AKS versions as they are made available.
Azure.AKS.AutoUpgrade.Recommendation: Consider enabling auto-upgrades for AKS clusters by setting an auto-upgrade channel.

Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Name: Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.DisplayName: AKS clusters should collect platform diagnostic logs
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Synopsis: AKS clusters should collect platform diagnostic logs to monitor the state of workloads.
Azure.AKS.PlatformLogs.Recommendation: Consider configuring diagnostic settings to capture platform logs from AKS clusters.

Azure.AKS.HttpAppRouting.Name: Azure.AKS.HttpAppRouting
Azure.AKS.HttpAppRouting.Synopsis: Disable HTTP application routing add-on in AKS clusters.
Azure.AKS.HttpAppRouting.Recommendation: Consider disabling the HTTP application routing add-on in your AKS cluster. Also consider using Application Gateway Ingress Controller (AGIC) instead to protect application endpoints.

Azure.Automation.AuditLogs.Name: Azure.Automation.AuditLogs
Azure.Automation.AuditLogs.Synopsis: Ensure automation account audit diagnostic logs are enabled.
Azure.Automation.AuditLogs.Recommendation: Consider configuring diagnostic settings to record interactions with data or the settings of the Automation Account.

Azure.AKS.DNSPrefix.Name: Azure.AKS.DNSPrefix
Azure.AKS.DNSPrefix.DisplayName: Use valid AKS cluster DNS prefix
Azure.AKS.DNSPrefix.Synopsis: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) cluster DNS prefix should meet naming requirements.
Azure.AKS.DNSPrefix.Recommendation: Consider using a DNS prefix that meets naming requirements.

Azure.Template.ResourceLocation.Name: Azure.Template.ResourceLocation
Azure.Template.ResourceLocation.DisplayName: Use a location parameter for regional resources
Azure.Template.ResourceLocation.Synopsis: Template resource location should be an expression or global.
Azure.Template.ResourceLocation.Recommendation: Consider updating the resource location property to use [parameters('location)].

Azure.FrontDoor.WAF.Enabled.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.WAF.Enabled
Azure.FrontDoor.WAF.Enabled.Synopsis: Front Door Web Application Firewall (WAF) policy must be enabled to protect back end resources.

Azure.AKS.AuditLogs.Name: Azure.AKS.AuditLogs
Azure.AKS.AuditLogs.DisplayName: AKS clusters should collect security-based audit logs
Azure.AKS.AuditLogs.Synopsis: AKS clusters should collect security-based audit logs to assess and monitor the compliance status of workloads.
Azure.AKS.AuditLogs.Recommendation: Consider configuring diagnostic settings to capture security-based audit logs from AKS clusters.

Azure.MariaDB.DatabaseName.Name: Azure.MariaDB.DatabaseName
Azure.MariaDB.DatabaseName.Synopsis: Azure Database for MariaDB databases should meet naming requirements.
Azure.MariaDB.DatabaseName.Recommendation: Consider using names that meet Azure Database for MariaDB database naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.

Azure.FrontDoor.Probe.Name: Azure.FrontDoor.Probe
Azure.FrontDoor.Probe.DisplayName: Use Health Probes for Front Door backends
Azure.FrontDoor.Probe.Synopsis: Use health probes to check the health of each backend.
Azure.FrontDoor.Probe.Recommendation: Consider configuring and enabling a health probe for each Front Door backend.

Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure
Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Synopsis: Ensure insecure inbound traffic is not permitted to the container app.
Azure.ContainerApp.Insecure.Recommendation: Consider disabling insecure traffic and require all inbound traffic to be over TLS 1.2.

Azure.Resource.UseTags.Name: Azure.Resource.UseTags
Azure.Resource.UseTags.Synopsis: Azure resources should be tagged using a standard convention.
Azure.Resource.UseTags.Recommendation:
Consider tagging resources using a standard convention. Identify mandatory and optional tags then tag all resources and resource groups using this standard.
Also consider using Azure Policy to enforce mandatory tags.

Azure.Defender.Servers.Name: Azure.Defender.Servers
Azure.Defender.Servers.DisplayName: Configure Microsoft Defender for Servers to the Standard tier and P2
Azure.Defender.Servers.Recommendation: Consider using Microsoft Defender for Servers P2 to protect your virtual machines.

Azure.APIM.ProductTerms.Name: Azure.APIM.ProductTerms
Azure.APIM.ProductTerms.Synopsis: Set legal terms for each product registered in API Management.
Azure.APIM.ProductTerms.Recommendation: Consider configuring legal terms for all products to declare acceptable use of included APIs.

Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Name: Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors
Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Synopsis: Policy assignments should use a display name and description.
Azure.Policy.AssignmentDescriptors.Recommendation: Consider setting a display name and description for each policy assignment.

Azure.ContainerApp.Name.Name: Azure.ContainerApp.Name
Azure.ContainerApp.Name.Synopsis: Container Apps should meet naming requirements.
Azure.ContainerApp.Name.Recommendation: Consider using container app names thas meets naming requirements. Additionally consider naming resources with a standard naming convention.
